excuses.name: #protein-tho
excuses.description: We need to eat meat to get protein
excuses.response: You can get your protein from plants
excuses.socraticResponse: Do you think we can get protein from other sources besides animals? What are some of those sources? Since we have the option to get protein from a source that does not cause suffering and another source that causes sufferin, which option do you think we should choose?

excuses.name: #lions-tho
excuses.description: Lions eat gazelles
excuses.response: Lions eat other animals for survival. We don't do it for survival
excuses.socraticResponse: Do you think lions need to eat other animals to survive? Do you think we need to eat animals to survive? Do you think we can live healthy lives without eating animals? If we don't need to eat animals to live a healthy life, why do you think we eat them? Do you think pleasure, tradition, and convenience are justify the suffering we inflict on animals? Why do you only copy that one behavior lions do? Lionesses sometimes eat their cubs when they're ill, lions kill other's cubs when they take over territory, and smell each other's ass.

excuses.name: #taste-tho
excuses.description: I like the taste of meat too much
excuses.response: Taste is not worth the suffering of animals
excuses.socraticResponse: Do you think taste justifies the suffering you inflict on animals?

excuses.name: #nature-tho
excuses.description: It's natural to eat meat
excuses.response: Appeal to nature. Just because something is natural does not mean it's moral
excuses.socraticResponse: Do you think we should base our morality on nature?

excuses.name: #culture-tho
excuses.description: It's part of my culture
excuses.response: Just because something is part of your culture does not mean it's moral
excuses.socraticResponse: Do you think culture justifies the suffering you inflict on animals?

excuses.name: #health-tho
excuses.description: I need meat to be healthy
excuses.response: A study done by the American Dietetic Association concluded that the most healthy diet is a plant based diet. You can get all the nutrients you need from plants. A study done by the Harvard School of Public Health found that a plant based diet is associated with a 34% lower risk of death from heart disease, a 50% lower risk of death from cancer, and a 76% lower risk of death from diabetes
excuses.socraticResponse: Do you think we can live healthy lives without eating animal flesh, milk, eggs, honey, and other animal products?

excuses.name: #halal-tho
excuses.description: With halal meat, the animal doesn't feel pain
excuses.response: Halal meat is not painless. A study done in New Zealand in 2009, which used an EEG (brainwave) method, shows that slaughter without stunning causes pain (Gibson et al, 2009 ab). Also, the animal still suffers from fear and stress their whole lives before they are slaughtered. They are fully conscious when they are killed.
excuses.socraticResponse: Let's say that halal meat is painless. Do you think that just because their death is 'painless' it justifies making them suffer from fear and stress their whole lives before they are slaughtered?

excuses.name: #kosher-tho
excuses.description: With kosher meat, the animal doesn't feel pain
excuses.response: Kosher meat is not painless. The animal is still killed in the same way
excuses.socraticResponse: Let's say that kosher meat is painless. Do you think that just because their death is 'painless' it justifies making them suffer from fear and stress their whole lives before they are slaughtered?

excuses.name: #why-dont-you-liberate-animals-tho
excuses.response: Liberating animals is not a practical thing to do. Eating a plant based diet is.
excuses.description: Veganism is about reducing animal suffering as much as it's practically possible. Liberating animals and getting arrested is not a practical thing to do. It's not about being perfect. The only way to cause zero suffering is by killing yourself.
excuses.socraticResponse: Is that a practical thing to do?

excuses.name: #convenience-tho
excuses.description: It's hard to be vegan
excuses.response: It's harder for the animals to live a life full of suffering than it is for you to be vegan
excuses.socraticResponse: Who is it harder for? You or the animals in factory farms and slaughterhouses?

excuses.name: #history-tho
excuses.description: Humans have been eating animals for thousands of years
excuses.response: It used to be necessary for humans to survive. Now, it's not necessary anymore. We have other options. Just because humans have been doing something for a long time does not justify doing it in today's society
excuses.socraticResponse: It used to be necessary. Now, it's not. Just because humans have been doing this for thousands of years, do you think that justifies, doing it in today's society?

excuses.name: #humans-are-animals-tho
excuses.description: Humans are animals too
excuses.response: We have the ability to think and reason. We have the ability to make moral decisions. We have the ability to choose not to cause suffering. We have the ability to choose not to eat animals
excuses.socraticResponse: Do you think we have the ability to think and reason? Do you think we have the ability to make moral decisions? Do you think we have the ability to choose not to cause suffering? Do you think we have the ability to choose not to eat animals?

excuses.name: #hipocrisy-tho
excuses.description: You're a hypocrite. You bought an iPhone which was made by child labor
excuses.response: Appeal to hipocrisy. Just because I did something wrong doesn't mean my point is invalid
excuses.socraticResponse: Just because I did something wrong, does that mean my point is invalid?

excuses.name: #your-activism-is-not-effective-tho
excuses.description: Your activism is not effective. You can't turn everyone vegan
excuses.response: Appeal to futilism. Just because there is not perfect solution that will solve all the problems, doesn't mean we shouldn't try to solve the problems
excuses.socraticResponse: What about you though? I'm not talking to everyone else righ now. I'm talking to you. Are you against animal abuse? Just because there is no perfect solution, do you think that means we should do nothing to solve the problem?

excuses.name: #tradition-tho
excuses.description: This is an important tradition for me
excuses.response: Just because something is part of your tradition does not mean it's moral
excuses.socraticResponse: Do you think that tradition justifies the suffering you inflict on animals?

excuses.name: #culture-tho
excuses.description: This is an important part of my culture
excuses.response: Just because something is part of your culture does not mean it's moral
excuses.socraticResponse: Do you think that culture justifies the suffering you inflict on animals?

excuses.name: #religion-tho
excuses.description: God put animals here for us to eat
excuses.response: Appeal to religion. Just because something is in the bible does not mean it's moral
excuses.socraticResponse: If god put animals here for us to eat, why do you think he gave them the ability to feel pain and suffer?

excuses.name: #other-issues-tho
excuses.description: There are other issues that are more important
excuses.response: You can care about other issues and still not eat animals
excuses.socraticResponse: Do you think that just because there are other issues, it justifies the suffering you inflict on animals? Do you think we can care about other issues and still not eat animals?

excuses.name: #canine-teeth-tho
excuses.description: Humans have canine teeth. We are meant to eat meat
excuses.response: Humans have: 1) small dull canine teeth, 2) short, soft fingernails, and 3) long and skinny intestines. All true carnivores have: 1) large canine teeth that are capable of tearing flesh without the help of knives and forks, 2) sharp claws, and 3) short and thick intestines meant to digest meat. We can eat meat, but we don't need to
excuses.socraticResponse: Do you think that we can live a healthy life without eating meat? If meat is not necessary for us to live healthy, do you think that justifies the suffering you inflict on animals?

excuses.name: #priveleged-issue-tho
excuses.description: This is a priveleged issue to care about
excuses.response: You can care about other issues and still not eat animals
excuses.socraticResponse: Do you think that just because there are other issues, it justifies the suffering you inflict on animals? Do you think we can care about other issues and still not eat animals?

excuses.name: #expensive-tho
excuses.description: Veganism is expensive
excuses.response: If you eat whole foods, it's cheaper to be vegan than it is to eat meat. The cheapest foods at the supermarket are vegan, like potatoes, rice, beans, and bananas. If you eat junk food, it's more expensive to be vegan than it is to eat meat. The only reason why processed vegan foods are more expensive than processed meat foods is because the meat industry is heavily subsidized by the government. If the government stopped subsidizing the meat industry, processed vegan foods would be cheaper than processed meat foods
excuses.socraticResponse: Do you think that plant-based whole-foods such as rice, beans, and potatoes is more expensive than meat? Do you think that that the reason why processed vegan foods are more expensive than processed meat foods is because the meat industry is heavily subsidized by the government? Do you think that if the government stopped subsidizing the meat industry, processed vegan foods would be cheaper than processed meat foods?

excuses.name: #humane-killing-tho
excuses.description: We kill animals humanely
excuses.response: Humane means showing compassion or benevolence. You can't humanely kill someone who does not want to die. Also, they not only suffer when they are killed. They suffer their entire lives
excuses.socraticResponse: What's your definition of the word 'humane'? Do you think that it's possible to humanely kill someone who does not want to die?

excuses.name: #jobs-tho
excuses.description: If people stop eating animals, many people will lose their jobs.
excuses.response: People can get other jobs. Animals only have one life.
excuses.socraticResponse: Do you think people can get other jobs? Do you agree that animals only have one life? Do you think that because this is people's jobs it justifies causing immense suffering to animals?

excuses.name: #it's-hard-tho
excuses.description: It's hard to change my diet
excuses.response: It's harder for the animals to live a life full of suffering than it is for you to be vegan
excuses.socraticResponse: Who is it harder for? You or the animals in factory farms and slaughterhouses?

excuses.name: #I'm-vegetarian-tho
excuses.description: I'm vegetarian so I'm on your side
excuses.response: I don't promote vegetarianism because vegetarians still cause immense suffering to animals
excuses.socraticResponse: Do you think vegetarians cause animals to suffer by paying for animal products like dairy, eggs, and honey?

excuses.name: #what-will-happen-to-the-animals-tho
excuses.description: If everyone went vegan, what would happen to the animals in factory farms?
excuses.response: The world won't go vegan overnight so this is a non-issue. The transition to veganism will be a gradual process so less and less animals will be bred for food each year. The remaining animals will be given to sanctuaries where they will live out the rest of their lives in peace
excuses.socraticResponse: Do you think that the world will go vegan overnight?

excuses.name: #been-eating-less-meat-tho
excuses.description: I've been eating less meat
excuses.response: That's not good enough. You're still hurting animals. With any other injustice, you would not say 'I've been doing less of it'. You would say 'I've stopped doing it
excuses.socraticResponse: Would you say the same thing about any other injustice? Would you do less of it or would you just stop doing it?

excuses.name: #jesus-tho
excuses.description: Jesus ate meat tho
excuses.response: Jesus didn't have the options we have
excuses.socraticResponse: Do you agree Jesus didn't have the options we have?

excuses.name: test
excuses.description: test
excuses.response: test
excuses.socraticResponse: test

excuses.name: #local-farms-tho
excuses.description: local farms
excuses.response: local farms
excuses.socraticResponse: local farms

excuses.name: test submit
excuses.description: test submit
excuses.response: test submit
excuses.socraticResponse: test submit

excuses.name: test mui text field
excuses.description: test mui text field
excuses.response: test mui text field
excuses.socraticResponse: test mui text field

excuses.name: test mui text field 2
excuses.description: test mui text field 2
excuses.response: test mui text field 2
excuses.socraticResponse: test mui text field 2

excuses.name: test all mui inputs
excuses.description: test all mui inputs
excuses.response: test all mui inputs
excuses.socraticResponse: test all mui inputs
